dorks.title: Subdomain Enumeration via Site Operator
dorks.description: Discovers indexed subdomains of the target domain
dorks.defensive_note: Monitor which subdomains are publicly indexed. Remove staging/dev environments from search engine indexing.

dorks.title: Related Domains and Mirrors
dorks.description: Finds websites related to the target domain
dorks.defensive_note: Be aware of unofficial mirrors or phishing sites impersonating your domain.

dorks.title: Cached Pages Discovery
dorks.description: Views Google's cached version of web pages
dorks.defensive_note: Ensure sensitive content is properly secured as cached versions may persist.

dorks.title: Exposed PDF Documents
dorks.description: Finds publicly indexed PDF files that may contain sensitive information
dorks.defensive_note: Audit all PDFs on your domain. Implement authentication or add robots.txt exclusions for sensitive documents.

dorks.title: Excel Spreadsheets Exposure
dorks.description: Discovers Excel files that may contain financial data, user lists, or business intelligence
dorks.defensive_note: Never store sensitive spreadsheets in publicly accessible locations. Use proper access controls.

dorks.title: SQL Database Dumps
dorks.description: Finds SQL dump files that may contain complete database exports
dorks.defensive_note: Immediately remove any SQL files from web-accessible directories. Never commit database dumps to public repos.

dorks.title: Configuration Files - .env
dorks.description: Discovers environment configuration files containing API keys, passwords, and secrets
dorks.defensive_note: Add .env files to .gitignore and web server deny rules. Rotate any exposed credentials immediately.

dorks.title: Configuration Files - config.php
dorks.description: Finds PHP configuration files that may expose database credentials and application settings
dorks.defensive_note: Store config files outside web root or use .htaccess to block direct access.

dorks.title: Backup Files
dorks.query: site:target.com ext:bak OR ext:backup OR ext:old
dorks.description: Locates backup files that may contain outdated code or sensitive data
dorks.defensive_note: Never store backups in web-accessible directories. Use automated cleanup scripts.

dorks.title: Log Files Exposure
dorks.description: Discovers log files that may reveal system paths, errors, and user activities
dorks.defensive_note: Store logs outside web root and implement log rotation. Ensure logs don't contain sensitive data.

dorks.title: Password Files
dorks.description: Searches for text files containing password information
dorks.defensive_note: Use password management tools. Never store passwords in plain text files.

dorks.title: WordPress Config Files
dorks.description: Finds WordPress configuration files containing database credentials
dorks.defensive_note: Ensure wp-config.php is not web-accessible. Use proper file permissions (644 or restrictive).

dorks.title: SSH Private Keys
dorks.query: site:target.com ext:pem OR ext:key OR ext:ppk
dorks.description: Locates SSH private key files
dorks.defensive_note: Never upload private keys to web servers. Rotate exposed keys immediately.

dorks.title: Admin Login Panels
dorks.query: site:target.com inurl:admin OR inurl:login OR inurl:administrator
dorks.description: Discovers administrative login interfaces
dorks.defensive_note: Implement rate limiting, CAPTCHA, and use non-standard admin URLs. Enable MFA.

dorks.title: PHP Admin Panels
dorks.description: Finds PHP-based admin panels
dorks.defensive_note: Use strong authentication, implement IP whitelisting for admin areas.

dorks.title: WordPress Admin Login
dorks.description: Locates WordPress admin login pages
dorks.defensive_note: Change default admin URL, use security plugins, enable two-factor authentication.

dorks.title: CPanel and WHM Access
dorks.description: Discovers hosting control panel interfaces
dorks.defensive_note: Restrict cPanel access to specific IPs, use strong passwords and SSL certificates.

dorks.title: phpMyAdmin Interfaces
dorks.description: Finds phpMyAdmin database management interfaces
dorks.defensive_note: Protect phpMyAdmin with additional authentication, use non-standard URLs, IP restrictions.

dorks.title: Test and Staging Environments
dorks.query: site:target.com inurl:test OR inurl:staging OR inurl:dev
dorks.description: Locates development and testing environments that may have weak security
dorks.defensive_note: Remove or secure test environments. Add authentication and remove from search indexing.

dorks.title: SQL Error Messages
dorks.description: Finds pages displaying SQL error messages revealing database structure
dorks.defensive_note: Disable detailed error messages in production. Log errors server-side only.

dorks.title: PHP Error Messages
dorks.query: site:target.com intext:"Warning: include" OR intext:"Fatal error"
dorks.description: Discovers pages showing PHP errors revealing file paths and code issues
dorks.defensive_note: Set display_errors = Off in production php.ini. Use error_log for debugging.

dorks.title: Stack Traces
dorks.description: Finds detailed error stack traces exposing application internals
dorks.defensive_note: Disable verbose error output. Implement custom error pages.

dorks.title: Directory Listings
dorks.description: Discovers directories with directory listing enabled
dorks.defensive_note: Disable directory browsing in web server config (Options -Indexes for Apache).

dorks.title: Apache Server Status
dorks.description: Finds exposed Apache server status pages
dorks.defensive_note: Restrict access to server-status or disable the module entirely.

dorks.title: Exposed Git Repositories
dorks.description: Discovers accessible .git directories containing complete source code history
dorks.defensive_note: Never deploy .git folders to production. Add deny rules in web server config.

dorks.title: GitHub References
dorks.description: Finds GitHub repositories mentioning the target domain
dorks.defensive_note: Monitor public repositories for leaked credentials or sensitive information.

dorks.title: Pastebin Leaks
dorks.description: Searches for information about target domain posted on Pastebin
dorks.defensive_note: Monitor paste sites for credential dumps and data leaks.

dorks.title: API Keys in Code
dorks.description: Searches for exposed API keys in accessible code or pages
dorks.defensive_note: Use environment variables for API keys. Implement secrets management solutions.

dorks.title: Email Addresses Harvesting
dorks.description: Collects email addresses for social engineering or spam purposes
dorks.defensive_note: Consider obfuscating email addresses or using contact forms instead.

dorks.title: AWS Keys Exposure
dorks.description: Searches for exposed AWS access keys
dorks.defensive_note: Rotate exposed AWS keys immediately. Use AWS Secrets Manager or IAM roles.

dorks.title: Open Directory - Files
dorks.description: Finds open directories with file listings available for browsing
dorks.defensive_note: Disable directory indexing in web server configuration.

dorks.title: Video Files Exposure
dorks.query: site:target.com ext:mp4 OR ext:avi OR ext:mkv OR ext:flv
dorks.description: Discovers video files that may be private or confidential
dorks.defensive_note: Implement proper access controls for media files. Use CDN with authentication.

dorks.title: Audio Files Discovery
dorks.query: site:target.com ext:mp3 OR ext:wav OR ext:flac
dorks.description: Finds audio files that may be publicly accessible
dorks.defensive_note: Ensure audio content is intentionally public or properly secured.

dorks.title: Archive Files
dorks.query: site:target.com ext:zip OR ext:rar OR ext:tar OR ext:gz
dorks.description: Locates compressed archives that may contain sensitive files
dorks.defensive_note: Never store sensitive archives in web-accessible locations.

dorks.title: LinkedIn Organization Info
dorks.description: Finds LinkedIn profiles and company information for reconnaissance
dorks.defensive_note: Be aware of public employee information that could aid social engineering.
